documents.document:
Google Chrome OS to launch this fall



From ZDNet

After months of waiting since the official announcement last November, Google has finally picked a time to release the Chrome operating system: this fall.

According to AFP, Google execs have confirmed that the open-source Chrome OS will be available for free, although no month nor date during autumn has been specified.

It’s also yet to be known whether any new (or old, maybe) devices to be released at that time will be running on the Chrome OS. It could be an interesting selling tool for the holiday season, although it’s not clear cut how much this will challenge Microsoft Windows just yet.

Now I can see what is going to replace with Windows system on Google employees Desktop. Check this "Google ditches Windows on security concerns"
Which mention that

New hires are now given the option of using Apple’s Mac computers or PCs running the Linux operating system. “Linux is open source and we feel good about it,” said one employee. “Microsoft we don’t feel so good about.”

More and more OS level development from Google will be great competition for Canonical, Microsoft & Apple.

From slashdot.org

"On Wednesday Google's vice president of product management said that this fall Google will launch Chrome OS to compete with Microsoft Windows. More than 70 million users already use the Chrome Browser, and Google expects at least 1 million users of the OS by day one of release."

For more information:
http://www.slashgear.com/tags/google-chrome-os/
http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE65112220100602
http://www.liliputing.com/2010/06/google-chrome-os-to-launch-this-fall.html

Android based Tablet released by India at Rs 1,500



Today I just hit with news which is about 30$ Tablet. After little study I found out that it is based upon Android OS. Read more: http://www.amitkarpe.com/2010/07/android-based-tablet-released-by-india.html

Mulshi Trip - Palase Waterfall

Palase (???? ) waterfall at Mulshi Dam. Dist: 45KM from Pune. Time: It took 1:30 hours to reach at Palase from Shaniwar Wada. For more : http://www.amitkarpe.com/2010/07/mulshi-trip-palase-waterfall.html

PLUG Talk at H. V. Desai College

We had last PLUG talk at H. V. Desai College, behind Shaniwar Wada, Pune 2. We had Bain ( Abhijit Bhopatkar ) and Chaitannya Mahatme as speaker. Full blog at http://ping.fm/aaean

12 August at Rajwada

We had went to Hotel Rajwada, Baner road, Pune on 12 August. It was my 28th birthday Full blog at http://www.amitkarpe.com/2010/08/12-august-at-rajwada.html

Peepli Live Movie Review

On 15 August we ( me & my wife Swatee ) had watch movie called “Peepli Live”. That movie ticket was given by Cybage Software on occasion of India’s Independence Day. We had seen lots of adds on TV about this movie, so we were excited to watch this movie. And you all know Amir Khan Production is some thing which always attracts your attention. Personally I had lots of expectation from this movie. And movie director Anusha Rizvi did really well to I can give give 8/10 rating.

Read more: http://www.amitkarpe.com/2010/08/peepli-live-movie-review.html

We had celebrated India’s Independence Day on 15th of Augu

We had celebrated India’s Independence Day on 15th of August at our IT Milan Shakha in Kasba Peth, Pune. As we all Indian truly proud of our nation, every Indian express this feeling with various ways. We as RSS ( Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh ) Swayamsevak do Bharat Mata Pujan in every shakha.

Full Blog at http://www.amitkarpe.com/2010/08/15th-of-august-independence-day-bharat.html

My New Dell Studio 15 Laptop

Yesterday I received My New Dell Studio 15 Laptop from Dell India. I had ordered it from Dell Exclusive Store Pune at Tilak Road, Sadashiv Peth. Full blog at: http://ping.fm/TkYbS

Introduction to Panda Board

PandaBoard is the low-cost, open OMAP4 processor-based mobile software development platform. PandaBoard is supported by a dedicated community at Pandaboard.org.

Read more: http://www.amitkarpe.com/2010/10/introduction-to-panda-board.html
